H0.text: where is simple squamous epithelium found in the body. Blood vessels

H1.text: where is simple squamous epithelium found in the body. Kidney glomeruli

H2.text: where is simple squamous epithelium found in the body. Liver sinusoids

H3.text: where is simple squamous epithelium found in the body. alveoli

A4.text: Simple squamous epithelium is found in the lining of blood vessels, specifically called endothelium.

A5.text: Simple squamous epithelium is found in the glomeruli of the kidneys.

A6.text: Simple squamous epithelium is found in the alveoli of the lungs.

A7.text: Liver sinusoids have a lining of specialised endothelial cells known as the liver sinusoidal endothelial cells (LSECs)
